refnamediv.refpurpose: arrays of bytes, which grow automatically as elements are added.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GByteArray is based on GArray, to provide arrays of bytes which grow automatically as elements are added.
To create a new GByteArray use g_byte_array_new().
To add elements to a GByteArray, use g_byte_array_append(), and g_byte_array_prepend().
To set the size of a GByteArray, use g_byte_array_set_size().
To free a GByteArray, use g_byte_array_free().

example.title: Using a GByteArray

refsect2.title: struct GByteArray
refsect2.para: The GByteArray struct allows access to the public fields of a GByteArray.

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the element data. The data may be moved as elements are added to the GByteArray.
the number of elements in the GByteArray.

refsect2.title: g_byte_array_sized_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GByteArray with reserved_size bytes preallocated. This avoids frequent reallocation, if you are going to add many bytes to the array. Note however that the size of the array is still 0.

refsect2.title: g_byte_array_append ()
refsect2.para: Adds the given bytes to the end of the GByteArray. The array will grow in size automatically if necessary.

listitem.simpara: the byte data to be added.
the number of bytes to add.

refsect2.title: g_byte_array_prepend ()
refsect2.para: Adds the given data to the start of the GByteArray. The array will grow in size automatically if necessary.

listitem.simpara: the byte data to be added.
the number of bytes to add.

refsect2.title: g_byte_array_remove_index ()
refsect2.para: Removes the byte at the given index from a GByteArray. The following bytes are moved down one place.

listitem.simpara: the index of the byte to remove.

refsect2.title: g_byte_array_remove_index_fast ()
refsect2.para: Removes the byte at the given index from a GByteArray. The last element in the array is used to fill in the space, so this function does not preserve the order of the GByteArray. But it is faster than g_byte_array_remove_index().

listitem.simpara: the index of the byte to remove.

refsect2.title: g_byte_array_remove_range ()
refsect2.para: Removes the given number of bytes starting at the given index from a GByteArray. The following elements are moved to close the gap.

listitem.simpara: the index of the first byte to remove.
the number of bytes to remove.

refsect2.title: g_byte_array_sort ()
refsect2.para: Sorts a byte array, using compare_func which should be a qsort()-style comparison function (returns -1 for first arg is less than second arg, 0 for equal, 1 if first arg is greater than second arg).

refsect2.title: g_byte_array_sort_with_data ()
refsect2.para: Like g_byte_array_sort(), but the comparison function takes a user data argument.

refsect2.title: g_byte_array_set_size ()
refsect2.para: Sets the size of the GByteArray, expanding it if necessary.

listitem.simpara: the new size of the GByteArray.

refsect2.title: g_byte_array_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees the memory allocated by the GByteArray. If free_segment is TRUE it frees the actual byte data.

listitem.simpara: if TRUE the actual byte data is freed as well.
